meanings.definition: Phosphenes: a sensation of seeing light without light actually entering the eye.
meanings.sent1: After rubbing my eyes, I saw colorful phosphenes dancing in the darkness.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that phosphenes can occur due to pressure on the eye.
meanings.sent3: When I closed my eyes tightly, the mischievous phosphenes decided to put on a light show.
meanings.sent4: The phosphenes in my vision were like tiny fireflies, flickering in the night.
meanings.sent5: Her description of phosphenes made it seem like a magical trick played by the eyes.

meanings.definition: Phosphenes: the luminous image produced by mechanical stimulation of the retina, as by pressure applied to the eyeball through the closed lids.
meanings.sent1: He experienced phosphenes when he gently pressed on his closed eyelids.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the phosphenes in his painting, creating a surreal effect.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous phosphenes seemed to be playing hide-and-seek with his vision.
meanings.sent4: The phosphenes appeared like glowing orbs, floating in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The sudden appearance of phosphenes startled him, as if his eyes were painting their own pictures.
